answers.answer: Viagra doesn't help if there is a vascular problem or a problem with hormones (i.e. testosterone levels).I would ensure that a good vascular exam (i.e. checking pulses) be done to ensure there are no issues with blood flow.A blood test to check the testosterone level should be considered.  If you have diabetes, this should be controlled.You can discuss these options with a urologist.  There are some cases where Levitra or Cialis can be tried if Viagra isn't working.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.Medical Weblog:kevinmd_b

question: I have been unable to maintain an erection for several years.I have tried viragra and that really didn't help me.  Couldthere be some other answer to correct this problem?  I amin my 60's and have been married for 43 years and thisproblem has been comming on slowly for about 20 yrs. Onlyin the last several has it become very serious. Can yourgive me any advise as to another step to take to correct thisproblem?  Up until this time my wife and I have enjoyed ourrelations although I have always had a low sex drive whenwe did get together it was always good.  Thank you.
title: If viragra doesn't work then what's wrong?
